translation: But even if thou thinkest of It as constantly being born and constantly dying, even then, O mighty-armed one, thou shouldst not grieve.
commentary: 2.26 Then now? f and? Anam this (Self)? Nityajatam constantly born? constantly constantly? or or? Thinkest thinkest? Dead dead? However even then? You thou? Mightyarmed mightyarmed? Not not? Evam thus? shochitum to grieve? Arhasi (thou) oughtest.Commentary Lord Krishna here? for the sake of argument? takes up the popular assumption. Granting that the Self is again and again born whenever a body comes into being?
